biography.value: The largest or most intelligent bullywugs invariably end up leading their kind. A royal is often mounted astride a giant toad or accompanied by one (see the Monster Manual for the giant toad;giant toad’s stat block).

description.value: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts.
A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

The royal makes two Spear attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit (with advantage if the royal is mounted on a toad), reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a [[/save str 13 format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Amphibious. The royal can breathe air and water.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Speak with Frogs and Toads. The royal can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Standing Leap. The royal’s long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Toad Rider. The royal has advantage on melee attacks its makes while riding a toad mount.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The royal makes a loud pronouncement. Each ally of the royal that is within 60 feet of the royal and can hear the pronouncement has advantage on its first attack roll on its next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
